edu.cs.tum.mturk
Class MTurk

java.lang.Object
  edu.cs.tum.mturk.MTurk
Direct Known Subclasses:
MTurkExtended
public class MTurk
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides a simple interface to interact with Amazon Mechanical Turk to annotate Word Sense Disambiguation Tasks (post new tasks, evaluate submitted task, and more)

Author:
Stephan Epping

createQualification

public void createQualification(com.amazonaws.mturk.addon.HITDataInput input,
                                MTurkProperties properties)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Creates an qualification test on MTurk

Parameters:
input - test questions in a specific format (sentence wordindex synsetid)
properties - specifications similar to the standard HIT properties attributes (see sample file)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

expireTasks

public void expireTasks(com.amazonaws.mturk.addon.HITDataInput input)
Expire the specified tasks now

Parameters:
input - list of HITs to expire

extendTasks

public void extendTasks(com.amazonaws.mturk.addon.HITDataInput input,
                        java.lang.Integer assignmentsIncrement,
                        java.lang.Long expirationIncrementInSeconds)
Extends the specified tasks for a certain time and number of assignments

Parameters:
input - List of HITs
assignmentsIncrement - minimum number is 1
expirationIncrementInSeconds - time to extend on each task

evaluateTask

public MTurkResult evaluateTask(java.lang.String hitId,
                                com.amazonaws.mturk.addon.HITDataOutput output,
                                MTurkWorkerPool pool)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Evaluate a specific task

Parameters:
hitId - unique task id
output - location, if task can NOT be evaluated completely
Returns:
the result, which can be used to commit(pay the worker) and export all results
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.Exception

                                                      MTurkWorkerPool pool)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
Evaluates all tasks in the input file

Parameters:
input - List of HITs
output - Not processed tasks are stored here
Returns:
List of Task results

java.io.IOException

createSecureTasks

public int createSecureTasks(java.lang.String[] sentences,
                             java.lang.String context,
                             MTurkProperties properties,
                             java.lang.String hitTypeId,
                             com.amazonaws.mturk.addon.HITDataOutput logfile,
                             int acc,
                             com.amazonaws.mturk.addon.HITDataInput input,
                             int secureQuestions)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Creates task with some secure questions inside

Parameters:
sentences - List of sentences to process
properties - information about the task like title, assignments, etc
hitTypeId - if null an new task group will be created
logfile - location, where all posted task are stored
acc - number of questions in each task
input - inputfile with verifyable questions
secureQuestions - number of secure questions per task
Returns:
number of posted tasks
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

createTasks

public int createTasks(java.lang.String[] sentences,
                       java.lang.String context,
                       MTurkProperties properties,
                       java.lang.String hitTypeId,
                       com.amazonaws.mturk.addon.HITDataOutput logfile,
                       int acc)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a new tasks for every word (Noun, Verbs, Adverb, Adjectives) in the provided sentences

Parameters:
sentences - List of sentences to process
properties - information about the task like title, assignments, etc
hitTypeId - if null an new task group will be created
logfile - location, where all posted task are stored
acc - number of questions in each task
Returns:
number of posted tasks
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

Parameters:
properties - properties to identify the group
Returns:
new taskgroup identifier
